title: Unhandled exception in XAML viewer when the project is in a path with private characters
body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/Unhandled-exception-in-XAML-viewer-when-/10063972)._

---
Apologies for putting the problem here. My "Report a problem.." doesnt work from my visual studio

To reproduce.
You will need to create a private character.  So run eudcedit.exe from windows run dialog. Ive attached an example picture of the character I created.
![image.png](https://aka.ms/dc/image?name=B3ce3ce2414f8420990ad54061479530d637902139858699766_20220607-175326-image.png&tid=3ce3ce2414f8420990ad54061479530d637902139858699766)

next thing. Create a directory with the private character in windows. Once again.. Ive attached a picture
![image.png](https://aka.ms/dc/image?name=Bbe04430ae29d45eeb8a8a0ed1f2840af637902141347584853_20220607-175555-image.png&tid=be04430ae29d45eeb8a8a0ed1f2840af637902141347584853)


Now create a WPF project  in visual studio in the directory below the one that you created above.
Then try and open the designer to the main dialog.
You should see the error below.. 
![image.png](https://aka.ms/dc/image?name=B361aa3ef60554ca78ef720e046fb57e6637902142514001459_20220607-175752-image.png&tid=361aa3ef60554ca78ef720e046fb57e6637902142514001459)
Now this error not only applies to WPF .. but  projects created with .Net48 doesnt compile when placed under such a directory. In fact many things dont work when placed under such a directory.

nodes.body: The images are broken, both here and in the VS Feedback link, but the user did follow up with additional comments in the VS Feedback issue. I'm transferring to msbuild.
